definition: to do harm to/to cause trouble to/harm/evil/calamity

sentences.english: The group of swindlers provided false information to entrap customers.
sentences.chinese: 這夥騙子提供假信息坑害顧客。

sentences.english: All About West entrap us how much money ?
sentences.chinese: 大話西遊坑害了我們多少錢？

sentences.english: He denied doing any harm to the owner.
He stabbed his friend in the back by stealing from his store.
sentences.chinese: 他從他朋友店裏偷東西，暗中坑害他的朋友。

sentences.english: She frwveryed Tom for something he never did.
sentences.chinese: 她坑害湯姆幹了一些他從未乾過的事。

sentences.english: Many evil merchants swindle the customers by imposing fake goods on them .
sentences.chinese: 許多無良商人用假冒僞劣商品坑害消費者。

sentences.english: They let her in at Genoa .
sentences.chinese: 他們在熱那亞一味坑害她。

sentences.english: However, this was the last entrapment case to feature that conflict.
sentences.chinese: 不過，這是最後坑害案件特點，就是衝突。

sentences.english: Still some businessmen use the calculator that has made motion and gage to entrap consumer.
sentences.chinese: 還有的商家使用做過手腳的計算器和量尺坑害消費者。

sentences.english: The consumer must be protected against the sale of poor-quality goods.
sentences.chinese: 消費者應該受到保障，免受銷售劣質產品的坑害。

sentences.english: Many evil merchants swindle the customers by imposing fake goods on them to make profits.
sentences.chinese: 許多無良商人用假冒僞劣商品坑害消費者，賺取利益。

definition: ruthless and lacking in conscience/vicious mind full of hatred and jealousy/black core (flaw in pottery)
to make a fool out of/to fool/to dupe
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to rock/to sway/to flicker (e.g. of lights reflected on water)/to flutter (e.g. of a flag)/to trick sb into doing sth/to dupe/to con
